content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the start and end points of the problem are swapped, the new shortest path should be the reverse of the original shortest path.)

The shortest path from node 10 to node 9 in the given graph is:

10 -> 8 -> 23 -> 9

Please note that this path assumes that the start and end points of the problem are swapped. If you need the original shortest path reversed, then the shortest path would be:

9 -> 23 -> 8 -> 10

In both cases, the shortest path is through nodes 8 and 23.

The shortest path from node 9 to node 10 in the given graph is:

9 -> 8 -> 23 -> 10

In this path, you follow node 9, then node 8, and finally nodes 23 and 10. It's a single-hop path and is therefore the shortest possible path from node 9 to node 10.
